intro: Acetosella glabra, commonly known as mouse ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its rosette of small, rounded, hairy leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pinkish flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and meadows. Acetosella glabra is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its ability to tolerate a variety of soil conditions.
